item.title: Philly Stake With WiFi...Mmm
item.description: Philadelphia’s most exciting new venture is citywide WiFi, generating significant buzz after Earthlink abandoned a similar project. This isn’t a completely new endeavor, but rather a revival of the existing infrastructure under new management, a group of local investors confident in their ability to succeed. Their strategy is based on free access for consumers, a welcome change from the $20 monthly fee for the previous unreliable service. Although a discounted plan was offered, even a reduced cost can be prohibitive for low-income residents.
